oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Song Of The Coward - Johnny Cash performance; Please Don't Play Red River Valley - Johnny Cash performance
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance of the Song Of The Coward, produced by Don Law and Frank Jones, recorded on January 12, 1966 at Columbia Recording Studio in Nashville, TN, and performed by Johnny Cash (vocal and guitar), the Carter family (background vocals), Bob Johnson (guitar), Luther Perkins (guitar), Marshall Grant (bass), and W.S. Holland (drums). Performance of Please Don't Play Red River Valley, written by Johnny Cash, produced by Don Law and Frank Jones, recorded on January 12, 1966 at Columbia Recording Studio in Nashville, TN, and performed by Johnny Cash (vocal, guitar, and harmonica), the Carter family (background vocals), Bob Johnson (guitar), Luther Perkins (guitar), Marshall Grant (bass), W.S. Holland (drums), and Del Wood (piano).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Johnny Cash
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Johnny Cash performs "Song Of The Coward" / (3:42) [Unidentified] says record master number / (3:46) Johnny Cash performs "Please Don’t Play Red River Valley"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Law, Donald F., 1902-1982; Jones, Frank, 1928-2005; Columbia Records, Inc; Cash, Johnny, 1932-2003; Carter Family (Musical group); Grant, Marshall (Bassist); Perkins, Luther; Wood, Del; Holland, W. S.
